intro: Pedicularis subacaulis, commonly known as the slender monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
